definition: at or towards the back of the stage in a theatre
the main ship in a fleet of ships in the navy
the most important product, service, building, etc. that an organization owns or produces

reminding you of somebody/something
showing that you are thinking about the past, especially in a way that causes you pleasure
giving only the information that is necessary and important, using few words
shorter than the original book, on which it was based
the space between two lines or surfaces that join, measured in degrees
a corner on the outside or inside of something
the direction that something is leaning or pointing in when it does not go straight up and down or straight across from side to side
a position from which you look at something
a particular way of presenting or thinking about a situation, problem, etc.
to criticize or blame somebody because they have done something wrong
strong criticism
to pull a car, boat, etc. behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain
to pull somebody along behind you
a result that you try to achieve

an object that people practise shooting at, especially a round board with circles on it
a type of coffee made with hot frothy milk and sometimes with chocolate powder on the top
a cup of cappuccino
a drink made by adding a small amount of strong coffee to a glass or cup of hot frothy milk
a mixture of mud and straw, dried in the sun and used as a building material
sex between a married person and somebody who is not their husband or wife
a plant with small divided leaves and purple flowers, grown as food for farm animals and as a salad vegetable
a spirit who is believed to be a servant of God, and is sent by God to deliver a message or perform a task. Angels are often shown dressed in white, with wings.
a person who is very good and kind; a child who behaves well
used when you are talking to somebody and you are grateful to them
a person who supports a business by investing money in it, especially somebody who supports a new small business with their own money
people with little experience try to do the difficult or dangerous things that more experienced people would not consider doing
one of the straight sections from top to bottom into which text on a page or screen is divided
a series of numbers or words arranged one under the other down a page
a part of a newspaper, magazine or website that appears regularly and deals with a particular subject or is written by a particular writer
a tall, solid post, usually round and made of stone, that supports or decorates a building or stands alone as a monument
a thing that is like a column in shape
a long, moving line of people or vehicles
connected with the task of preparing something such as a newspaper, a book or a television or radio programme, to be published or broadcast
a person who reads the news on television or radio
a person who reads the news on television or radio
a heavy metal object that is attached to a rope or chain and dropped over the side of a ship or boat to keep it in one place
a person or thing that gives somebody a feeling of safety
a person who presents a live radio or television programme and introduces reports by other people; an anchorman or anchorwoman
a man who presents a live radio or television programme and introduces reports by other people
a woman who presents a live radio or television programme and introduces reports by other people
the crime of doing something that could cause danger to your country, such as helping its enemies during a war
an animal with grey fur and wide black and white lines on its head. Badgers are nocturnal (= active mostly at night) and live in holes in the ground.
a person who is an expert in law
anger between people who disagree
a belief or an opinion that you express, especially in an argument
a subject that causes people to disagree
with a chance of winning something
without a chance of winning something
a scientist who studies anatomy
a strong feeling such as love, fear or anger; the part of a person’s character that consists of feelings
an amount of money
the number you get when you add two or more numbers together
all of something, especially when you think that it is not very much
a simple problem that involves calculating numbers
to be better or more effective as a group than you would think just by looking at the individual members of the group
used to introduce a short statement of the main points of a discussion, speech, etc.
not important or serious; not worth considering
a recording of a book, especially a novel, being read aloud, made available to download or on a CD
a small circle of paper or cloth with a pattern of very small holes in it, that you put on a plate under a cake or sandwiches
a small attractive mat that you put on top of a piece of furniture
without any sun; receiving no light from the sun
a type of poplar tree, with leaves that move even when there is very little wind
a small fruit that grows on a bush. There are several types of berry, some of which can be eaten.
to give a spoken or written answer to somebody/something
to do something as a reaction to something that somebody has said or done
to react quickly or in the correct way to something/somebody

a group of feathers that stand up on top of a bird’s head

father

used to say that a particular situation or fact makes you sad or disappointed, or gets you into a difficult position
by good luck
a person who is not brave or who does not have the courage to do things that other people do not think are especially difficult
to find an acceptable solution to a problem or difficulty
to make a definite decision to do something
